verses.roman:
darpopaśamanāyāsya
pravṛkṇā bāhavo mayā
sūditaṁ ca balaṁ bhūri
yac ca bhārāyitaṁ bhuvaḥ

synonyms: darpa—the false pride; upaśamanāya—for subduing; asya—his; pravṛkṇāḥ—severed; bāhavaḥ—arms; mayā—by Me; sūditam—slain; ca—and; balam—the military force; bhūri—huge; yat—which; ca—and; bhārāyitam—having become a burden; bhuvaḥ—for the earth.
translation: It was to subdue Bāṇāsura's false pride that I severed his arms. And I slew his mighty army because it had become a burden upon the earth.
